items.label: prob-revival-kl-mean-field
items.title: Main Research Question
items.content:
361: :label: prob-revival-kl-mean-field
362: 
363: Let $\mathcal{R}[\rho, m_d]$ be the mean-field revival operator defined in [05_mean_field.md](../1_euclidean_gas/07_mean_field.md):
364: 
365: $$
366: \mathcal{R}[\rho, m_d](x,v) = \lambda_{\text{revive}} \cdot m_d \cdot \frac{\rho(x,v)}{\int_\Omega \rho}
367: $$
368: 
369: where $m_d = 1 - \int_\Omega \rho$ is the dead mass and $\lambda_{\text{revive}}$ is the revival rate.
370: 
371: **Question**: Is $\mathcal{R}$ **KL-non-expansive**? That is, does it satisfy:
372: 
373: $$
374: D_{\text{KL}}(\mathcal{R}(\rho) \| \mathcal{R}(\sigma)) \le D_{\text{KL}}(\rho \| \sigma)
375: $$
376: 
377: for all alive densities $\rho, \sigma \in \mathcal{P}(\Omega)$ with $\int \rho = \int \sigma < 1$?
378: 
379: **Status**: **RESOLVED** - See Section 7 and Stage 2

items.label: prob-finite-n-vs-mean-field
items.title: Critical Differences Between Finite-N and Mean-Field
items.content:
552: :label: prob-finite-n-vs-mean-field
553: 
554: | Aspect | Finite-N Cloning | Mean-Field Revival | Implication |
555: |:-------|:-----------------|:-------------------|:------------|
556: | **Dimensionality** | Finite $(Nd)$ | Infinite (function space) | Compactness arguments may fail |
557: | **Noise** | Explicit $\delta \xi$ noise | No explicit noise in $\mathcal{R}$ | Fisher information regularization unclear |
558: | **Nonlinearity** | Linear in empirical measure | Nonlinear (division by $\\|\rho\\|_{L^1}$) | May create singularities |
559: | **Discreteness** | Discrete selection among N walkers | Continuous sampling from $\rho$ | Combinatorial structure lost |
560: | **Companion selection** | Finite sample ($j \in \mathcal{A}$) | Integral over $\rho$ | Correlations differ |

items.label: prob-explicit-kl-condition
items.title: Open Question from Explicit Calculation
items.content:
677: :label: prob-explicit-kl-condition
678: 
679: The KL-non-expansiveness of $\mathcal{R}$ is equivalent to:
680: 
681: $$
682: \lambda (1-m_\rho) \log \frac{1-m_\rho}{1-m_\sigma} \le m_\rho \log \frac{m_\rho}{m_\sigma}
683: $$
684: 
685: plus a term involving the normalized KL-divergences.
686: 
687: **Special case** ($m_\rho = m_\sigma$): Both log terms vanish, and we get:
688: 
689: $$
690: \lambda (1-m_\rho) D_{\text{KL}}(\tilde{\rho} \| \tilde{\sigma}) \le m_\rho D_{\text{KL}}(\tilde{\rho} \| \tilde{\sigma})
691: $$
692: 
693: This holds iff $\lambda (1 - m_\rho) \le m_\rho$, i.e., $\lambda \le \frac{m_\rho}{1 - m_\rho}$.

items.label: prob-gemini-collaboration-tasks
items.title: Critical Tasks for Gemini Collaboration
items.content:
921: :label: prob-gemini-collaboration-tasks
922: 
923: 1. **Refine the two-state counterexample**: Develop a rigorous lower-dimensional model where calculations are exact. Determine precisely when KL-non-expansiveness holds.
924: 
925: 2. **Investigate joint operator**: Instead of analyzing $\mathcal{R}$ alone, study the composed operator $\mathcal{J} = $ (killing + revival). Does the killing term compensate for revival's entropy increase?
926: 
927: 3. **Explore alternative formulations**: Can we reformulate the revival operator to make KL-properties more transparent? E.g., as a Bayesian update with explicit noise?
928: 
929: 4. **Check literature**: Has anyone studied KL-properties of proportional resampling operators in McKean-Vlasov systems? Search for related results in QSD theory, population dynamics, branching processes.
